radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar atelectasis; enlarged, hyperemic appendix with wall thickening measuring up to 13 mm; moderate fat stranding in the right lower quadrant; mild thickening of the adjacent terminal ileum and cecum; engorgement of mesenteric vessels; multiple reactive mesenteric lymph nodes measuring up to 7 mm; small amount of nonhemorrhagic ascites; normal liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys; trace free fluid in the pelvis; transitional anatomy with lumbarization of L5; small left inguinal hernia containing fat.
